traits.initial_skepticism: Responds to Philip’s announcement about Jesus of Nazareth with the question, 'Can anything good come out of Nazareth?', expressing regional skepticism.
traits.encounter_with_jesus: Jesus greets him as an Israelite in whom there is no deceit and reveals knowledge of him under the fig tree, leading to surprise and confession.
traits.confession_of_jesus: Confesses Jesus as the Son of God and the King of Israel, marking one of the earliest and highest christological acclamations in the Gospel.
traits.promise_of_greater_vision: Hears Jesus’s promise that he will see heaven opened and angels ascending and descending on the Son of Man, evoking Jacob’s ladder and suggesting deeper revelation.
traits.post_resurrection_presence: Listed among the disciples present by the Sea of Tiberias when the risen Jesus appears and shares breakfast with them.
traits.critical_note: Later Christian tradition often identifies Nathanael with Bartholomew of the Synoptic lists, but the Gospel itself does not explicitly equate them.
